title: Similarities b/w Hare Krishna Japa & Dhruva Maharaj's Tapasya
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Maharaj

segments.text: Now let us come to our chanting of Hare Krishna. How is it that we can show our, what is our
similar to Dhruva Maharaj? Not necessarily because it's not a bodily thing. Our whole
process here, he had a particular material desire in his mind. In our case, if you take
an analogy, I repeated earlier also, if we can hear the Hare Krishna, Hare Krishna, Krishna
Krishna, Hare Hare, Hare Rama, Hare Rama, Rama Rama, Hare Hare.
With two things in mind. One is, I should give uninterrupted attention. That means attention
should not go anywhere. Attention should not get diluted. Undiluted attention. That means
attention is uninterrupted.
His chant start from bead one, start from bead two, start from bead three, start from
bead four, start from bead five, start from bead six, start from bead seven, start from
bead seven, go on, without breaking attention. And attention breaker are, what is the famous
attention breaker? Thinking. Thinking is attention breaker. So without thinking, if you can hear
Hare Krishna, Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna, Hare Hare, Hare Rama, Hare Rama, Rama Rama,
Hare Hare, that alone is not enough. You should have undiluted intention. Why you should
have undiluted intention? Why are you chanting? Forgetting mystic power? Or forgetting association
of the Lord as well as mystic power? Then dilution will happen. Undiluted in intention.
What is undiluted in intention? What is your intention? Association of the Nama who has
descended. I only want his association, nothing else.
In the material world we meet, oh I want to meet him because in the end of it, I want
to gain something. I am going to meet this person. You have an intention. What is that
intention? Something for you. You have an intention, isn't it? Similarly, tendency of
the mind is to actually when you are chanting Hare Krishna, something I have to get. Instead,
we should simply think, I just want to associate with this Sachidananda Vigraha who is, Shabdavigraha
who is before me.
Just want to associate. So that consciousness, undiluted attention and undiluted intention.
Undiluted attention is a negative thing. We are saying it should not be diluted, but where
should the attention be? Fully on the Nama and it should be undiluted. And what should
be the intention to associate and please the Lord? That should be the intention of the
Nama. The intention to associate and please the Lord. That should be the intention of the Nama.
the positive intention. It should not be undiluted by, it should not be diluted by intention
for this one, that one, so many other things. It should not be diluted. So if we can chant,
this is what we should practice. This is soulful japa. This is the foundation of soulful japa.
Then bhavanas are there. That is a different thing. Bhavanas have to naturally come. Or
bhavanas have, bhavana should not, our feelings or bhavana in the background, it should only
be in the background. Foreground should be completely absorbed in chanting uninterruptedly
with undiluted intention for the association of the Lord. So we also have got a big deal.
Dhruva Maharaj is taking a lot of tapasya. It didn't happen overnight. Not that he decided
and said, I am going to do this. I am going to do this. I am going to do this. I am going
to do this. Suddenly he went into this state. No! Six months standing, then he attained
that perfection. Similarly, simply today, if you decide, I want to do uninterrupted,
undiluted japa. It's not an instant decision. Okay, today's round, undiluted. You should
do everyday's japa, you should try to do uninterrupted and undiluted intention. We should do, we should
but you should know it is a process
